profileText: A Representative from New Jersey; born in Mount Holly, Burlington County, N.J., November 27, 1817; attended private schools at Mount Holly; prepared for college at Mendham; graduated from Princeton College, 1836; lawyer, private practice; elected as a Republican to the Thirty-sixth and to the succeeding Congress (March 4, 1859-March 3, 1863); was not a candidate for renomination in 1862; delegate to the Union National Convention of Conservatives at Philadelphia, 1866; president of the Farmers' National Bank of Mount Holly in 1875; died on May 17, 1889, Mount Holly, N.J.; interment in St. Andrews Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1861, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John Leake Newbold Stratton to President Abraham Lincoln written on March 4, 1861. In the letter, John Stratton recommends Rufus Andrews as United States District Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

recordLocation.name: Department of Literary and Historical Manuscripts
